COURSE DESCRIPTION

This course aims to prepare students to use English in business settings and to discuss selective business-related topics. Relevant terminologies and patterns will be introduced and practiced in each class meeting. Students are expected to use four skills to participate in a variety of in-class activities, including discussion and role-play. In the end of this course, students will be asked to work on a group proposal with clear and persuasive language.

PROPOSAL: I want to run a business! (3-5 people in one group)

Description: Imagine that you want to start your own business. Many decisions have to be made, with a lot of investigation and research. You have to do research and decide, for example,

1.  what you want to sell or run,
2.  whether the business is online, in-store, or both,
3.  where is the niche market,
4.  how you promote the business,
5.  how you develop a staffing plan,
6.  how you draw up a budget plan, and

The list could go on and on.

Midterm Progress Presentation

The midterm progress presentation will cover essential elements of starting a business. Every student is expected to be responsible for one part of the proposal. You will get comments and questions from the instructors and the classmates. NO written paper is required.

Final Proposal Presentation

This is the revised proposal. Every student is expected to be responsible for one part of the proposal. NO written paper is required. Please note the contributions made by every group member on the slides.

Reviews: **Individual or pair, audio/video**

You are expected to do some research on the shop/business you want to run. Based on a problem you encountered while working on the proposal (for example, how to decide the location of a shop or how to fix the price of your products), you have to

1.  pick a reference or a theory (a book, a news clip, a video, or a commercial), such as the Big Mac Index, the IKEA effect, self-herding, and infomercials,
2.  introduce and summarize your reference to your classmates,
3.  note how the reference helps you to solve the said problem(s), and
4.  upload your audio/video as a YouTube video or an episode of podcast.

      5. Each student is required to watch/listen to 5 videos from different groups and leave **_encouraging and constructive_** comments.
